entries.title: A wake-up call for WxPerl
entries.text: Just as 2012 ended Steve Cookson kicked off a thread with an emotional mail about the future of WxPerl, the Perl binding of the wxWidgets toolkit. Many people jumped on the thread. Some pessimistic, some optimistic. In any case, there seem to be some momentum for movement, so if writing desktop applications is your thing, then look at the thread, how you might get involved.

entries.desc: Too often, peeps eschew test descriptions in TAP suites. Ovid explains why this is sub-optimal, and how those descriptions can be leveraged to make tests as self-documenting as possible.
entries.title: How to write a test description
DBI 1.623 was released
entries.text: Tim Bunce has announced the new released of the Database independent interface of Perl. See the list of bug fixes.

entries.desc: The mechanics of Git::CPAN::Patch got a major tune-up. Net result for users? Faster, much faster cloning.
entries.title: Git::CPAN::Patch -- Now with MetaCPAN Power!

entries.desc: Assumptions. Everyone knows what they make out of you and me. Well, rejoice, for David Wheeler announced that a new version of Sqitch is out, introducing a 'verify' command that will help to confirm that was supposed to be deployed really has been deployed.
entries.title: Sqitch: Trust, But Verify

entries.desc: New year, new release of DBD::Oracle. No new features this time around, but a fair amount of bug fixing.
entries.title: DBD::Oracle v1.54 on its way to CPAN

entries.desc: Ever cringed as you saw passwords being written in log files? Steffen Müller showcases Store::Opaque as a tool to use to ensure that this doesn't happen.
entries.title: Protect Against Accidental Logging of Sensitive Information

entries.desc: Pinto is a very nice tool to create and manage local Perl module repositories. Yanick investigates an alternate way of using it within a Dancer app to create a CPAN proxy.
entries.title: Picking Packages With Pass-through, Proxied Pinto
Karlsruhe Perl Mongers
entries.text: The first meeting of the Karlsruhe Perl Mongers will take place on 9 January 2013. Check out the German Perl Monger site for details.
